**"Daoist Three-Character Classic" by Yi Xinying**

**I: The Dao’s Single Qi Transforms the Three Pure Ones**
The Great Dao, one in *qi*, gives birth to the Three Pure Ones.
Most void and numinous, most subtle and profound.
Though named with force, it is the Great Dao.
Its essence is naturally so—
Manifest in Oneness, it precedes the Sovereign’s form.
Formless and boundless, its essence is profound.
From its mysterious transformation, light and sound arise.
It cleaves the murky chaos, gradually brightening.
The Boundless shifts, dividing into three *qi*s.
First, the Azure *qi*—named *Qingwei*.
The Dragon-Han kalpa shines with celestial splendor.
The Primordial White *qi*—named *Yuyu*.
The True Text appears, illuminating the Great Void.
The Dark-Yellow *qi*—named *Dachi*.
The Sovereign Above opens, and myriad transformations teem.

**II: The Three Caverns’ Scriptures and Talismans Surpass All Ages**
The Venerable Primordial One expounds the Cavern of Truth.
He initiates the Great Teaching, expounding the Three Vehicles.
The Venerable Soul-Treasure expounds the Cavern of Mystery.
Golden precepts are established; sacred talismans are transmitted.
The Venerable Dao and Virtue expounds the Cavern of the Divine.
Twelve divisions instruct gods and humans.
A sacred platform is erected within the Treasure Pearl.
Scriptures are transmitted, their meanings boundless.
Our august sovereign gathers the Cloud Books,
Correcting the Celestial Chant at the kalpa’s dawn.
He translates the Three Caverns, then the Four Auxiliaries—
Seventy-two in total, surpassing all ages.

**III: The Gods Proclaim the Dao and Ascend to Heaven**
From the Jade Pure to the Western Paradise,
The Mysterious Wind spreads, harmonizing transformations.
The Jade Emperor, most compassionate,
Abandons his royal seat, enduring hard practice through countless kalpas,
His resolve never dimmed.
He attains the Golden Immortal, named *Rulai*.
He rules the Jade Capital, pacifying the Xiao Platform.
The Heavenly Sovereign governs the Three Realms,
Reciting scriptures to sever obstacles.
He instructs the Bodhisattvas: no inner or outer distinction.
The Quiet and Mysterious Venerable, Lin Biancai,
Preaches the Law on the Nine-Harmony Terrace.
He initiates the Old Master, teaching the Way of Perfection.
He transforms kings, saving subjects.
His teachings spread to three thousand souls.
They receive this decree and ascend in broad daylight.

**IV: The Ancient Daoist Lineage Venerates the Great Cavern Scripture**
Tracing the source, we seek the distant past.
Those who verified the Dao recorded only the Universal.
Examining the True Lineage, we distinguish the ancestral sects.
Great and small sects are counted from the beginning.
The Ancient Daoist Lineage remains from antiquity,
Flourishing most brightly in the Yellow Emperor’s age.
To govern the realm, he emulated Guangcheng.
He visited Kongtong, discussing longevity.
He came to Jutusi, glimpsing Jinglu.
He honored the True Ones, offering the *Zhi Tu* diagram.
He explored the Nine Chambers of Qingcheng Peak,
Gaining the Dragon’s hoofprints—evidence remains.
He guarded the One Scripture, taught by the Immortal King.
He lectured on the principles of life, dispelling illness.
Without agitating the essence, without exhausting the spirit,
He preserved limbs and senses, discarding cleverness.
Harmonizing *qi* and spirit, he formed the Immortal embryo.
At twelve hundred years, his body showed no decay.
In the Pure Joy Realm, a prince emerged,
Free from dust, liberated from birth and death.
Entering the Great Harmony, he toiled diligently.
Brandishing the Wisdom Sword, he subdued the Two Tyrants.
Leaping from the Southern Cliff, he manifested True Martial.
His great deed accomplished, he repaid his parents.
King Fu Cha of Wu revered him deeply.
Seeking to save others, he went to Qi.
The *Kongdong Pian* was not lightly revealed.
This tradition, passed down for forty thousand kalpas,
Is one lineage, venerating the Great Cavern.
Researching the True Principle, Canghu was weighty.

**V: The Golden Elixir and Mysterious Refinement Are Complementary**
The Golden Elixir Sect began with Wa Huang.
He illuminated transformation, following Yin-Yang.
By the time of Xuanyuan, he devoted himself to research.
After governing and teaching, he pursued immortality.
He combined divine medicines, refining the Golden Elixir.
With the Dragon Chariot ascending, many near officials were saved.
Beneath Jing Mountain, ancient traces remain.
This is one lineage, venerating the Nine Cauldrons.
Refining mercury and lead, he exhausted the roots.
The Mysterious Refinement Sect received the True Transmission.
Huang Shi was instructed during the Zhou’s宣 era.
He clarified inner cultivation, the law being simplest:
Only still the heart—dispel desires.
Empty and still, observe the Three Essentials.
Only serene, aspiring to the Dao’s utmost.
This is one lineage, venerating Stillness.

Holding the Fixed Observation, the Round Pearl shines.

**VI: Embryonic Breath and Yellow Sprouts Return to Infantile Vitality**
The Changhuai Sect opened the Divine.
Dwelling above, he attained the True.
The Return-to-Root Method restores the Commanding Gate.
A single-character decree is pondered in stillness.
Observing clouds arise, he tunes the unstrung.
Exhausting the subtle and vast, he encompasses heaven and earth.
This is one lineage, venerating Embryonic Breath.
The Unstrung’s resonance connects to the Boundless.
The Harmony-Preserving Sect, from Master Contong,
Consumes the Five Sprouts, eating Cloud Flowers.
Strictly guarding, his Primordial Spirit is full.
His body unyielding, he defies Heaven’s work.
This is one lineage, venerating *Qi*-Nourishment.
Guarding the Mysterious Female, he returns to the Marvelous Truth.

**VII: The Inner Chamber Cultivates Life and Harmonizes the Spirit**
The Spirit-Harmonizing Sect was transmitted by Su Nu.
Life-preservation methods reveal human subtleties.
Healing myriad ailments, his skill was wondrous.
Restoring injuries, his face never aged.
He gathered *jing* and *qi*, filling marrow and brain.
Avoiding deceit, he was cautious in examination.
This is one lineage, venerating the Inner Chamber.
Clarifying the *Qi* Dao, he nurtures the Yang method.

**VIII: The Southern Palace’s Cangyi Strengthens Vitality and Spirit**
The Southern Palace Sect follows the One True.
Secret incantations subdue ghosts and gods.
Brandishing the Spirit Sword, demons flee.
Hidden forms appear—this must be verified in person.
This is one lineage, venerating Talismans and Charms.
Directing spirit and matter, merging with clouds.
The Cangyi Sect stems from Pengtong,
Who studied with Dayu and Shen Nong.
Refining cinnabar, he followed the Heavenly Pattern.
Gathering divine medicines, he used the Nine Additions.
Consuming stone elixirs, eating immortal herbs,
He transformed marrow into essence, returning to the Immortal form.
This is one lineage, venerating Alchemical Nourishment.
Extending life, preserving original essence.
The *Jianli* Sect flourished under Xi Nong.
Red Pine’s descendants numbered Ningfeng.
Healing vacuity and evil *qi*, one may prolong years.
Gargling the Spirit Elixir, calamities do not approach.
Lubricating joints, unblocking the *dantian*,
Strengthening the body, firming sinews and bones,
Subduing worms and snakes, removing afflictions,
Driving away evil diseases from a hundred *li* away.
This is one lineage, venerating *Daoyin* exercises.
Refining the subtle, entering the marvelous realm.

**IX: Establishing Altars to Subdue Evil—Narrated from the Beginning**
The Ritual Sect descended from Gao Xin.
Tending the Virtue Platform, he bore the Sacred Talisman.
Drawing on the Two Principles, he established the Mountain Spirit’s foundation.

「Nurturing the nation’s lineage, averting calamities and misfortunes.
Obtaining liberation, attaining the Mysterious Palace.
Hiding the Golden Tablet, sealing the Mountain’s decree.
The King of Xia, Yu, personally diligent and frugal.
Dredging the Nine Rivers, dispelling temporal afflictions.
Piercing the Gorge Gates, facing many perils.
Praying to the Mountain Spirit, aided by the Hidden Sage.
Revealing the Jade Seal, alongside the Sacred Talisman.
Severing worldly constraints, dispatching the Child of Law.
Mountain-dwelling incantations, subduing demons with might.
Forbidding mountain sacrilege, locking the Huai Whirlpools.
Fulfilling this life, harmonizing water and earth.
Merits accomplished, entering the Bright Yang Palace.

Between Wu and Hui, Zhang the recluse arose.
Plowing the riverside, he gained the Primordial Beginning.
Constructing the Spirit Hall, devoutly offering sustenance.
Moved by Heaven’s Venerable One, he received the Great Cavern.
Scriptures and Talismans’ methods, transmitted with the Heart Seal.
A single verse of praise, from Yuan Bo’s respect.
Warding off pestilence, eradicating epidemics.
Rooted wishful power, returning to the Supreme Deity.
King He of Yue, ascending to the baoqiu mound.
Gazing at the Forest Dwelling, he obtained Yu’s writings.
Combining one scroll, with red jade characters.
A hundred and seven, plus fourteen more.
The True Ritual Sect’s methods, their teachings preserved.
The Standard and Ritual formats, seven degrees in total.
Talismans and Rituals, precepts and laws.
Talismans a hundred and two, Rituals forty-six.
Precepts a thousand and two, laws aligned with Qi.
Great and small chapters, all part of the Ritual.
This one lineage, venerating the Spirit Treasure Dao.
Praising the Divine Illumination, reaching the most profound depths.

**X: The Pillared History Sect’s Esoteric Transmission—From Sanfeng**
The Pillared History Sect, esteemed as the Celestial Mysterious, descended to Sanfeng.
Revering the Pillared Historian, surnamed Youlong.
Beyond the Tang and Song, reaching Sanfeng.
Guān Lìng’s Marshal, the first transmission.
Composing nine chapters, expounding on its origins.
Xi Yi the Lord, hidden in Taihua.
The Woodian Gathering, a historian’s praise.
The Sixth Patriarch Zhang, named Hidden Sage.
Uniting the south and north, the Essentials of Mysterious Dao.
Below Xi Yi, the Daoist learning flourished.
The third transmission, Yao Fu received it.
The "Observing Things" chapter, a scripture for the world.
The Great Rounded Principle, harmonizing with the Void.
The sixth transmission, Lin Xi succeeded.
The Taiji Diagram, following the Old Master’s *Yijing*.
The Confucian school, with Master Zhongni.
The Sage of Law, his aspiration fulfilled.
Departing Zhou, during the reign of King Jing.
Inquiring about rites, he consulted Master Laozi.
After Zi Gong, it was Xun Qing.
Evaluating the scholars, their distinctions made clear.
Human hearts are perilous, the Daoist heart is subtle.
Sixteen characters, the Daoist scripture’s words.
The fifth transmission, thus Han Fei.
Interpreting Master Lao’s teachings, his name in the Law.
To Jia Yi, following the ancient sages.
Illuminating the Dao’s methods, refining the "Old Chapter."
The Eleventh: The Teachings of Daoism from Mount Mao—Many Transmitters
The Daoist Healing Sect, originating from the Elder.
To An Qi, teachings were divided.
The Yellow-Lao arts, skilled in governing the people.
Passed to Gai Gong, ending as a Han official.
Below An Qi, entrusted to Ma Ming.
Following Inner Learning, the True Sage of Yin.
Gaining the Great Clarity, entering Red City.
Refining White Gold, blessing the poor in times.
The third transmission, Wei Boyang.
Studying the *Tongqi* Contract, the King of the Alchemical Scriptures.
The Sage’s Transmission, straightforwardly stated.
Claiming the *Yijing* as metaphor, discussing the Elixir.
Tang Pengxiao, based on the Primordial Axis.
Clarifying the True Meaning, illuminating the Mirror Diagram.

The Teaching of the Mao Mountain Sect—Ghost Valley as Master
Instructed in the Foundations, concealed at Hua Mountain.
Shu Shen Jun, transmitted in the Western City.
Obtained the Two Scenes, returning to Jin Tan.
The Fifth Transmission, Qingxu True Sage.
The Eight Hidden Scriptures, the High Immortal Classic.
Sixth Transmission to Zhou, surnamed Zisun.
The Linghui Talisman, the Golden Mysteries Chapter.
Below Qingxu, Wei Fu Ren.
Retreating to the Quiet Chamber, mastering the Yellow Court.
The Ninth Generation, Yang Xi Jun.
Instructed in the True Law, composing the *Qu Su* Text.
Below Zisun, promoting Xu Ying.
Consuming Jade Elixir, receiving Brain Essence.
The Second Generation, Xu Shilang.
Healing abdominal ailments, practicing the Alchemical Prescriptions.
Jian Ji Gong, the Sixth in Line.
Cultivating the Daoist Canon, compiling the Scriptures and Talismans.
The Eighth Generation, Tao Zhengbai.
Interpreting the True Edicts, rectifying the Hidden Precepts.
The Eleventh Generation, surnamed Sima.
Sitting in Forgetfulness, attaining the Supreme Greatness.
Discussing humanity’s worth, valuing life.
Life in the Dao suffices, returning to True Nature.

The Twelve: Essential Alchemical Numerology of the Bo Immortal
The Alchemical Sect, descending from the Western Queen Mother.
Descending to the Muted Palace, instructing Emperor Wu of Han.
The Shangqing Scripture, twelve matters expounded.
Examining the Inner Transmission, meticulously recorded.

The Five Profits’ disciples, few grasp the True Meaning.

The *Hongbao* Classic, alas, long lost.
The Bo Immortal, transmitted by the Left Family.

Discussing Immortal Prescriptions, discerning the Primordial Intent.
Twelve Chapters, hailed as unparalleled skill.

The Thirteen: The Taiping Zhengyi Yu Zhang Sect
The Taiping Sect, taught by Yu Ji.
The *Qingling* Book, one hundred seventy scrolls.
Practicing this Law, successors multiplied.
Discussing the Revival of the Nation, weighing minutely.
Valuing the Scripture’s intent, only Xiang Kai.
Repeatedly petitioning, the ruler remained unmoved.
The Zhengyi Sect, the Han Heavenly Master.
The *Mengwei* Talisman, the Ritual Chapters.
Severing the Old Qi, dissolving the Three Activities.
Obtaining the Great Elixir, distinguishing true from false.
Venerating the *Doujing*, crossing the Jade Circuit.
Sixty-three generations, passed down through the ages.
The Mysterious Learning Sect, following He Wang.
The *Chongxu* Treatise, expounding Laozi and Zhuangzi.
To the Seven Worthies, learning without learning.
Gazing into the Hall’s depths, promoting Xiang Guo.
The Yu Zhang Sect, ancestral to Lan Qi.
The Filial and Fraternal King, the True Master.
Personally enlightening, digging three tombs.
Seeing corpses, his body suddenly whole.
Levitating afar, displaying supernatural power.
The Copper Talisman and Vouchers, containing divine efficacy.
Transmitted to Chen Mu, guarding the True Eagle.
Charging the Initiates, the Edict of Jingyang.
The Third Ancestor Xu, surnamed Xiantu.
The *Shifen* Record, the Cauldron of Law.

Practicing base arts, hiding in the marketplace.
The *Dalei* Scripture, bestowed by Mother Li.
Exterminating demonic forces, averting calamities.
The Elixir in the Jar, distributed for relief.
The *Cui Xu* Chapter, left to the scattered officials.
The Fifth Ancestor Bai, residing at Wuyi.
The *Haiqiong* Collection, revealing the Mysteries.

The Northern School’s Master, surnamed Chongyang.

Five Chapters of Text, attaining Sweet Tranquility.
Reviving the Dead, entering the Tomb Chamber.
Burning the Grass Hut, discerning true from false.
Journeying to the Eastern Sea, crossing the Fierce Steed.

The Nine-Turn Elixir, few comprehend.

**The Seventeenth: The Boundless Marvels of Knowing the Dao’s Movement and Stillness**
The Sect of the Talismans—now the Law is known
Movement and stillness, must be thoroughly understood
Water, Fire, Earth, Wood, Metal—
These Five Agents, mutually interdependent
Spirit, Soul, Mind, Intention—
These Five Essences, governed as one wills
Life’s Merit, Time’s Affairs—
These Five Thieves, cannot be seized
Inner Five Essences, Outer Five Thieves
Sudden interaction, tenfold karmic births arise
Karmic seeds take root, six desires manifest
The Seventeen Paths, thus established
Eye, nose, ear, tongue, body, mind—
Encountering good and evil, deep habits form
Lost in delusion, one becomes a mortal
Enlightened, one becomes a sage
Clarifying right and wrong, cultivating virtuous conduct
Celestial Immortals, Human Immortals,
Earthly Immortals, Spiritual Immortals,
And Heavenly Immortals—five ranks
Employing the Nine and Six, refining the threads of governance
From Immortal Truth to Supreme Sagehood
Each undergoes three transmigrations, nine grades respond
West and North, South and East—
Gathered in procession, entering the Central Palace
The Dragon and Tiger, the Alchemical Soil—
These Three Natures, converge in one place
Circulating the Heavenly Cycle, diligently refining
Flames ascend—True Persons manifest
Five Qi gather, body and function complete
The Three-One Transformation, wondrous without limit
The Dao-Body, the True-Body,
The Reward-Body—these are the Three Bodies
The Response-Body arises, another body born
Displaying marvelous forms, conforming to worldly constraints
Gathering and dispersing at will, without measure
A cloud of divided bodies, transforming into myriad symbols
The Original precedes, the Manifest follows
Appearing according to circumstances, ever not the same
The White Emperor, the Peerless Essence,
The Peach of Immortality, the Keeper of Fate,
The Grand Unity—these are the Five Spirits
The Comet’s fullness, the Spirit’s clarity
Heaven’s Vision, the Dharma’s Sound
Spiritual Contact, the Assembly of Spirits
Ancient Divine Intuition, the Omen’s Foreknowledge
Permeating the Dharmadhātu, without end
**The Eighteenth: Early Cultivation of the Six Virtues/Degrees**

Color’s burdens, Love’s burdens,
Greed’s burdens, Illusion’s burdens,

Profoundly embodying practice, attaining intuitive realization
The Degree of Right Faith, the Degree of Virtuous Stillness,
The Degree of Golden Brilliance, the Degree of Universal Virtue,
The Degree of Primordial Fate, the Degree of Perfect Truth—
Thus gradually attaining, the Six Degrees
Compassion and Love, Virtue and Patience—
The Four Practices suffice, the Alchemical Scriptures confirmed
The Virtue of Eternal Truth, the Virtue of Pure Response—
These Four Powers, the Celestial Capital’s proof
The Paths of Sage and Mortal, the Gates of Purity and Defilement
The Five Mortal Realms—no need for debate

The Yellow Ancestor, the Six Celestial Realms
A hundred merits, ascending and transforming
The Transcendent Balance, the Eighteen Celestial Realms
The Six Senses purified, coarse dust abandoned
The Subsequent Six Realms, light and subtle
The Further Six Realms, even lighter and more refined
The Celestial Passages—four more Realms

Gradually attaining the Marvelous, entering the Profound Mysteries
No descent into ruin, the Four Dharma Realms
The Constant Fusion, the Jade Elevation,
The Dharma Passage, the Final Termination—
These Four Mortalities, all Three Realms
Treading the Vehicles, none obstructed
Having clarified the Heavens, one must now discuss the Earth
The Earth follows the Heavens, its Qi encompassing all
The Ten Directions’ Realms, and the Abyssal Depths
The Six Non-Existent, encircling the Central Peak
The Indistinct and Undivided, the Great Primordial Chaos
The Clouds drift—boundless, neither high nor low
The Vast and Silent, the limitless expanse
The Net of Heaven, the Three Realms’ splendor
The Mist of Fine Rain, the Great and Flourishing
The Great Compass’ Motion, unobstructed
The Four Cardinal Paths, the Eight Round Realms
Floating in the Void, sustained by the Wind
The Wind’s friction, the Qi’s ascent
The Diamond’s Strength, riding upon the Heavens
The Sun, Moon, and Stars, doubling their revolutions
Layered layers traversed, like rolling a pill
Yin and Yang—too much or too little
If rigidly opposed, calamities ensue
The Nine Yangs, the Sixteen Yin
The Celestial Locks, the Earthly Axes
Calculating the Rebirths, three thousand six
Yin’s negation, Yang’s fervor
Heaven’s exhaustion of Yin, Earth’s exhaustion of Yang
The Two Great Wheels, in shared contention
Gazing upon the Above and Below, humans dwell in the Middle
Distanced from the Four Quarters, entering the Vaulted Heavens
Counting this Earth, until the Great Cataclysm
Without the Dao’s Power, who would not perish?
The Nourished Earth, the Golden Grain Earth,
The Iron Earth, the Watery Earth,
The Great Wind Earth—these are the Five Earths
The Void, Form, and Moisture, reaching the utmost subtlety
The Fifth Soil, the Sixth Soil,
The Floating Soil—these are the Three Soils

Guiding the People’s Scriptures, now clarified

The Way of the Supreme Sovereign, the Way of the Highest Truth,

Unobstructed Void, entering the Multitude of Marvels

Aspirations steadfast, all virtues arise

Removing defilements, diligently refining
Studying diverse arts, distilling their essentials
Ascending the stages, thus deeply cultivating
Peering into the Lapis Circle, probing the Mysteries’ Depths
Attaining Void and Stillness, no trace remains

Li the Eight-Hundred, the Ancient Lord of Shu

**I: The Dao’s Single Qi Transforms the Three Pure Ones**
The Great Dao, one in *qi*, gives birth to the Three Pure Ones.
Most void and numinous, most subtle and profound.
Though named with force, it is the Great Dao.
Its essence is naturally so—
Manifest in Oneness, it precedes the Sovereign’s form.
Formless and boundless, its essence is profound.
From its mysterious transformation, light and sound arise.
It cleaves the murky chaos, gradually brightening.
The Boundless shifts, dividing into three *qi*s.
First, the Azure *qi*—named *Qingwei*.
The Dragon-Han kalpa shines with celestial splendor.
The Primordial White *qi*—named *Yuyu*.
The True Text appears, illuminating the Great Void.
The Dark-Yellow *qi*—named *Dachi*.
The Sovereign Above opens, and myriad transformations teem.

**II: The Three Caverns’ Scriptures and Talismans Surpass All Ages**
The Venerable Primordial One expounds the Cavern of Truth.
He initiates the Great Teaching, expounding the Three Vehicles.
The Venerable Soul-Treasure expounds the Cavern of Mystery.
Golden precepts are established; sacred talismans are transmitted.
The Venerable Dao and Virtue expounds the Cavern of the Divine.
Twelve divisions instruct gods and humans.
A sacred platform is erected within the Treasure Pearl.
Scriptures are transmitted, their meanings boundless.
Our august sovereign gathers the Cloud Books,
Correcting the Celestial Chant at the kalpa’s dawn.
He translates the Three Caverns, then the Four Auxiliaries—
Seventy-two in total, surpassing all ages.

**III: The Gods Proclaim the Dao and Ascend to Heaven**
From the Jade Pure to the Western Paradise,
The Mysterious Wind spreads, harmonizing transformations.
The Jade Emperor, most compassionate,
Abandons his royal seat, enduring hard practice through countless kalpas,
His resolve never dimmed.
He attains the Golden Immortal, named *Rulai*.
He rules the Jade Capital, pacifying the Xiao Platform.
The Heavenly Sovereign governs the Three Realms,
Reciting scriptures to sever obstacles.
He instructs the Bodhisattvas: no inner or outer distinction.
The Quiet and Mysterious Venerable, Lin Biancai,
Preaches the Law on the Nine-Harmony Terrace.
He initiates the Old Master, teaching the Way of Perfection.
He transforms kings, saving subjects.
His teachings spread to three thousand souls.
They receive this decree and ascend in broad daylight.

**IV: The Ancient Daoist Lineage Venerates the Great Cavern Scripture**
Tracing the source, we seek the distant past.
Those who verified the Dao recorded only the Universal.
Examining the True Lineage, we distinguish the ancestral sects.
Great and small sects are counted from the beginning.
The Ancient Daoist Lineage remains from antiquity,
Flourishing most brightly in the Yellow Emperor’s age.
To govern the realm, he emulated Guangcheng.
He visited Kongtong, discussing longevity.
He came to Jutusi, glimpsing Jinglu.
He honored the True Ones, offering the *Zhi Tu* diagram.
He explored the Nine Chambers of Qingcheng Peak,
Gaining the Dragon’s hoofprints—evidence remains.
He guarded the One Scripture, taught by the Immortal King.
He lectured on the principles of life, dispelling illness.
Without agitating the essence, without exhausting the spirit,
He preserved limbs and senses, discarding cleverness.
Harmonizing *qi* and spirit, he formed the Immortal embryo.
At twelve hundred years, his body showed no decay.
In the Pure Joy Realm, a prince emerged,
Free from dust, liberated from birth and death.
Entering the Great Harmony, he toiled diligently.
Brandishing the Wisdom Sword, he subdued the Two Tyrants.
Leaping from the Southern Cliff, he manifested True Martial.
His great deed accomplished, he repaid his parents.
King Fu Cha of Wu revered him deeply.
Seeking to save others, he went to Qi.
The *Kongdong Pian* was not lightly revealed.
This tradition, passed down for forty thousand kalpas,
Is one lineage, venerating the Great Cavern.
Researching the True Principle, Canghu was weighty.

**V: The Golden Elixir and Mysterious Refinement Are Complementary**
The Golden Elixir Sect began with Wa Huang.
He illuminated transformation, following Yin-Yang.
By the time of Xuanyuan, he devoted himself to research.
After governing and teaching, he pursued immortality.
He combined divine medicines, refining the Golden Elixir.
With the Dragon Chariot ascending, many near officials were saved.
Beneath Jing Mountain, ancient traces remain.
This is one lineage, venerating the Nine Cauldrons.
Refining mercury and lead, he exhausted the roots.
The Mysterious Refinement Sect received the True Transmission.
Huang Shi was instructed during the Zhou’s宣 era.
He clarified inner cultivation, the law being simplest:
Only still the heart—dispel desires.
Empty and still, observe the Three Essentials.
Only serene, aspiring to the Dao’s utmost.
This is one lineage, venerating Stillness.

Holding the Fixed Observation, the Round Pearl shines.

**VI: Embryonic Breath and Yellow Sprouts Return to Infantile Vitality**
The Changhuai Sect opened the Divine.
Dwelling above, he attained the True.
The Return-to-Root Method restores the Commanding Gate.
A single-character decree is pondered in stillness.
Observing clouds arise, he tunes the unstrung.
Exhausting the subtle and vast, he encompasses heaven and earth.
This is one lineage, venerating Embryonic Breath.
The Unstrung’s resonance connects to the Boundless.
The Harmony-Preserving Sect, from Master Contong,
Consumes the Five Sprouts, eating Cloud Flowers.
Strictly guarding, his Primordial Spirit is full.
His body unyielding, he defies Heaven’s work.
This is one lineage, venerating *Qi*-Nourishment.
Guarding the Mysterious Female, he returns to the Marvelous Truth.

**VII: The Inner Chamber Cultivates Life and Harmonizes the Spirit**
The Spirit-Harmonizing Sect was transmitted by Su Nu.
Life-preservation methods reveal human subtleties.
Healing myriad ailments, his skill was wondrous.
Restoring injuries, his face never aged.
He gathered *jing* and *qi*, filling marrow and brain.
Avoiding deceit, he was cautious in examination.
This is one lineage, venerating the Inner Chamber.
Clarifying the *Qi* Dao, he nurtures the Yang method.

**VIII: The Southern Palace’s Cangyi Strengthens Vitality and Spirit**
The Southern Palace Sect follows the One True.
Secret incantations subdue ghosts and gods.
Brandishing the Spirit Sword, demons flee.
Hidden forms appear—this must be verified in person.
This is one lineage, venerating Talismans and Charms.
Directing spirit and matter, merging with clouds.
The Cangyi Sect stems from Pengtong,
Who studied with Dayu and Shen Nong.
Refining cinnabar, he followed the Heavenly Pattern.
Gathering divine medicines, he used the Nine Additions.
Consuming stone elixirs, eating immortal herbs,
He transformed marrow into essence, returning to the Immortal form.
This is one lineage, venerating Alchemical Nourishment.
Extending life, preserving original essence.
The *Jianli* Sect flourished under Xi Nong.
Red Pine’s descendants numbered Ningfeng.
Healing vacuity and evil *qi*, one may prolong years.
Gargling the Spirit Elixir, calamities do not approach.
Lubricating joints, unblocking the *dantian*,
Strengthening the body, firming sinews and bones,
Subduing worms and snakes, removing afflictions,
Driving away evil diseases from a hundred *li* away.
This is one lineage, venerating *Daoyin* exercises.
Refining the subtle, entering the marvelous realm.

**IX: Establishing Altars to Subdue Evil—Narrated from the Beginning**
The Ritual Sect descended from Gao Xin.
Tending the Virtue Platform, he bore the Sacred Talisman.
Drawing on the Two Principles, he established the Mountain Spirit’s foundation.

chunks.original_text: 茅山派，师鬼谷。 授初成，隐华岳。 叔申君，西城传。 得二景，归金坛。 第五传，清虚真。 八隐书，高仙经。 六传周，号紫阳。 灵晖箓，金玄章。 清虚下，魏夫人。 退静室，谙黄庭。 第九世，杨羲君。 授正法，曲素文。 紫阳下，推许映。 服玉液，朝脑精。 第二世，许侍朗。 愈腹疾，服术方。 简寂公，为第六。 修道藏，纂经箓。 八世陶，号贞白。 诠真诰，正隐诀。 十一世，称司马。 坐忘理，极正大。 论吾人，在贵生。 生道足，返天真。 十二：方仙要数葛仙翁 方仙派，西王母。 降闷宫，授汉武。 上清经，十二事。 稽内传，详为志。 十三传，皆方技。 五利徒，鲜真谛。 汉淮南，重丹器。 鸿宝书，惜久佚。 葛仙翁，左氏传。 流珠歌，记生前。 修真一，入大定。 经醮法，遗鲍郑。 晋抱朴，得郑书。 述丹道，千有余。 论仙方，识元意。 十二篇，称绝艺。 十三：太平正一豫章派 太平宗，师于吉。 青领书，百七十。 修此法，嗣息增。 论兴国，较铢分。 重经意，惟襄楷。 累上疏，君不解。 正一派，汉天师。 盟威箓，拜章仪。 斩故气，消三业。 得大丹，辨正邪。 奉斗经，度玉局。 六十三，沿世袭。 玄学派，宗何王。 崇虚论，述老庄。 至七贤，学无学。 窥堂奥，推向郭。 豫章派，祖兰期。 孝悌王，是本师。 亲点化，掘三墓。 见尸体，身忽合。 遥轻举，显神通。 铜符券，蕴神功。 传谌母，守真鹰。 嘱度者，旌阳令。 三祖许，号仙都。 石函记，法鼎炉。 十四：全真修道南北宗 南宗兴，祖伯端。 天回镇，师海蟾。 临行时，亲嘱咐。 脱汝法，当授度。 逢马氏，司真行。 至荆湖，饵丹升。 三祖薛，本僧衲。 参杏林，师环下。 通宗说，复命篇。 得外护，道乃全。 四祖陈，号泥丸。 习贱业，隐市廛。 大雷书，黎母授。 诛邪魔，除灾咎。 壶中药，随布济。 翠虚篇，遗散吏。 五祖白，居武夷。 海琼集，显秘密。 北宗师，号重阳。 宗钟吕，祖少阳。 五篇文，获甘镇。 活死人，入墓寝。 焚草庵，见真假。 赴东溟，度烈马。 未生前，亲抉剖。 九转丹，几人悟。 十五论，教化集。 揆诸经，括玄义。 邱刘谭，郝王孙。 元中主，尊龙门。 丹阳下，祖披云。 乌兔经，萃玄文。 四祖赵，居南岳。 同源论，悔后学。 致虚翁，是嫡传。 抒大要，阐先天。 长春下，祖志平。 承遗教，在燕京。 葆光集，及语录。 建道场，宏规模。 四祖李，名浩然。 西游记，称遗篇。 五祖王，着信心。 赠光教，主白云。 又八传，至冲虚。 撰正理，明玄机。 继此者，僧华阳。 着仙论，道法昌。 十五：元始演法留戒律 律宗法，传最古。 虚皇尊，留青土。 汉仙人，素行直。 奉新笠，百八十。 晋阮基，齐张岜，持大戒，礼宝偈。 唐潘公，品戒目。 重八一，轻州六。 三真戒，师道一。 勤修纂，法始卒。 曰玄都，并研习。 初遵十，中三百。 智慧戒，属妙德。 女真戒，爱此行。 勉过咎，律均衡。 至明季，嗣昆阳。 说心法，律益彰。 已上说，十三宗。 斋忏法，箓相从。 十六：三箓七斋天人通 曰金玉，曰黄箓。 此三斋，资冥福。 修金箓，喜宗皇。 躬祈祷，时雨将。 建鸿斋，道武君。 克寰宇，扫烟氛。 曰明真，曰自然。 曰三元，曰八节。 曰洞神，曰指教。 曰涂炭，为七品。 入圣法，升虚仪。

chunks.original_text: 遇修崇，福寿益。 救苦忏，启青玄。 宝幡动，礼妙严。 恩光力，瓶中柳。 肉白骨，起枯朽。 万灵忏，何人集。 柳真君，弟子俱。 灭灾祸，法琼篇。 通玄妙，了根源。 所南公，继诸家。 哀茕独，祭炼夸。 敕何乔，诣冥途。 拯滞魄，出幽都。 十七：知法动静妙无穷 宗箓明，当知法。 动与静，须了达。 曰水火，土木金。 此五行，互为因。 曰精神，魂魄意。 此五神，随所御。 曰命功，时物事。 此五贼，不可执。 内五神，外五贼。 忽相感，生十业。 业识起，有六欲。 十七乘，从此立。 眼鼻耳，舌身心。 缘善恶，结习深。 迷为凡，悟为圣。 明顺逆，修善行。 曰灵仙，曰人仙。 曰地仙，曰神仙。 并天仙，为五等。 用九六，絜纲领。 自仙真，至上圣。 各三迁，九品应。 西与北，南与东。 行攒簇，入中宫。 曰龙虎，曰丹土。 此三性，归一处。 运周天，勤烹炼。 火焰飞，真人现。 五气聚，体用全。 三一化，妙无边。 曰道身，曰真身。 曰报身，乃三身。 应身起，又生身。 示妙相，顺世困。 任聚散，无限量。 云分身，化万象。 前为本，后为迹。 随机显，常不一。 有白元，有无英。 有桃康，有司命。 有太一，为五灵。 彗圆备，神自明。 天视通，梵音通。 神触通，神会通。 夙神通，预兆通。 周法界，无不穷。 十八：至德六度早修行 曰天地，曰水途。 积世孽，当受辜。 曰色累，曰爱累。 曰贪累，曰华竟。 曰身累，此五苦。 并三途，为人难。 闻思修，归觉路。 善体行，得会悟。 正信度，定善度。 金华度，普德度。 元命度，全真度。 斯渐证，称六度。 慈与爱，善与忍。 四行足，丹书允。 曰真常，曰净应。 此四德，清都证。 圣凡路，净秽门。 凡五道，不须论。 十九：天地阴阳须自明 曰黄曾，有六天。 百善功，得升迁。 曰越衡，十八天。 六根净，粗尘捐。 次六天，细且轻。 再致六，轻染更。 曰霄度，乃四天。 忘心识，转气观。 渐为妙，入重玄。 无沦坏，四梵天。 曰常融，曰玉隆。 曰梵度，贾夷终。 此四民，并三界。 蹑诸乘，无滞碍。 既明天，须论地。 地依天，气包举。 十方界，及洞渊。 六无聚，拥京山。 混无分，沌朴大。 云莪莪，无高下。 溟寂然，梓无涯。 罗天布，三境奢。 蒙细雨，鸿益华。 洪钧运，无障遮。 径四维，八圆界。 浮虚空，风所待。 风虚摩，气抡然。 金刚力，乘乎天。 日月星，倍循环。 重重涉，似转丸。 阴与阳，过不及。 若扞格，生灾翳。 曰九阳，曰百六。 运天关，转地轴。 计轮回，三千六。 阴否蚀，阳激勃。 天穷阴，地穷阳。 两大轮，共颉颃。 观上下，人在中。 距四方，入穹窿。 数此地，至浩劫。 非道力，谁不灭。 润泽地，金粟地。 刚铁地，水泽地。 大风泽，称五地。 空色润，至微细。 曰戊土，曰已土。 曰浮黎，为三土。 二十：历代神仙把路引 度人经，且说明。 六十一，次第分。 太上道，上真道。 中真道，种种道。 知其几，观其窍。 空无碍，入众妙。 凡学人，当自体。 志向坚，万善举。 信能行，功无比。 除秽垢，勤磨洗。 参众术，撮枢要。 循阶梯，爰深造。 窥琅环，探玄奥。 致虚寂，无朕兆。 昔穆王，厌国情。 轻富贵，徂昆仑。 李八百，古蜀君。 去归隐，禅鳖灵。 王子晋，好神仙。 随浮邱，驾鹤还。

The Path of Encountered Veneration—Blessings of Longevity Abound
Expiating Sufferings, the Green Mysteries Unveiled
The Sacred Banner moves, rites of perfection solemnly observed
The Power of Graceful Light, the willow in the jar
Flesh turns to bone, decay revives
The Expiation of Ten Thousand Spirits—who gathers them?
The Lord of the Willow, his disciples united
Quelling calamities, the Law’s Radiant Scriptures
Piercing the Mysteries, comprehending the roots
The Master of the Southern Lands, succeeding all households
The lonely and bereaved, their sacrifices and refineries extolled
Commanding He Qiao, to the Nether Path he proceeds
Rescuing the stagnant souls, emerging from the Abyss

**The Seventeenth: The Boundless Marvels of Knowing the Dao’s Movement and Stillness**
The Sect of the Talismans—now the Law is known
Movement and stillness, must be thoroughly understood
Water, Fire, Earth, Wood, Metal—
These Five Agents, mutually interdependent
Spirit, Soul, Mind, Intention—
These Five Essences, governed as one wills
Life’s Merit, Time’s Affairs—
These Five Thieves, cannot be seized
Inner Five Essences, Outer Five Thieves
Sudden interaction, tenfold karmic births arise
Karmic seeds take root, six desires manifest
The Seventeen Paths, thus established
Eye, nose, ear, tongue, body, mind—
Encountering good and evil, deep habits form
Lost in delusion, one becomes a mortal
Enlightened, one becomes a sage
Clarifying right and wrong, cultivating virtuous conduct
Celestial Immortals, Human Immortals,
Earthly Immortals, Spiritual Immortals,
And Heavenly Immortals—five ranks
Employing the Nine and Six, refining the threads of governance
From Immortal Truth to Supreme Sagehood
Each undergoes three transmigrations, nine grades respond
West and North, South and East—
Gathered in procession, entering the Central Palace
The Dragon and Tiger, the Alchemical Soil—
These Three Natures, converge in one place
Circulating the Heavenly Cycle, diligently refining
Flames ascend—True Persons manifest
Five Qi gather, body and function complete
The Three-One Transformation, wondrous without limit
The Dao-Body, the True-Body,
The Reward-Body—these are the Three Bodies
The Response-Body arises, another body born
Displaying marvelous forms, conforming to worldly constraints
Gathering and dispersing at will, without measure
A cloud of divided bodies, transforming into myriad symbols
The Original precedes, the Manifest follows
Appearing according to circumstances, ever not the same
The White Emperor, the Peerless Essence,
The Peach of Immortality, the Keeper of Fate,
The Grand Unity—these are the Five Spirits
The Comet’s fullness, the Spirit’s clarity
Heaven’s Vision, the Dharma’s Sound
Spiritual Contact, the Assembly of Spirits
Ancient Divine Intuition, the Omen’s Foreknowledge
Permeating the Dharmadhātu, without end
**The Eighteenth: Early Cultivation of the Six Virtues/Degrees**

Heaven and Earth, the Waterways—
Accumulating worldly sins, one must suffer retribution
Color’s burdens, Love’s burdens,
Greed’s burdens, Illusion’s burdens,
The Body’s burdens—these are the Five Sufferings
And the Three Paths—truly human trials
Hearing and contemplating, one returns to the Path of Awakening
Profoundly embodying practice, attaining intuitive realization
The Degree of Right Faith, the Degree of Virtuous Stillness,
The Degree of Golden Brilliance, the Degree of Universal Virtue,
The Degree of Primordial Fate, the Degree of Perfect Truth—
Thus gradually attaining, the Six Degrees
Compassion and Love, Virtue and Patience—
The Four Practices suffice, the Alchemical Scriptures confirmed
The Virtue of Eternal Truth, the Virtue of Pure Response—
These Four Powers, the Celestial Capital’s proof
The Paths of Sage and Mortal, the Gates of Purity and Defilement
The Five Mortal Realms—no need for debate

**The Nineteenth: Heaven and Earth’s Yin and Yang Must Be Clarified**
The Yellow Ancestor, the Six Celestial Realms
A hundred merits, ascending and transforming
The Transcendent Balance, the Eighteen Celestial Realms
The Six Senses purified, coarse dust abandoned
The Subsequent Six Realms, light and subtle
The Further Six Realms, even lighter and more refined
The Celestial Passages—four more Realms
Forgotten are the mind and its perceptions, turning to Qi observation
Gradually attaining the Marvelous, entering the Profound Mysteries
No descent into ruin, the Four Dharma Realms
The Constant Fusion, the Jade Elevation,
The Dharma Passage, the Final Termination—
These Four Mortalities, all Three Realms
Treading the Vehicles, none obstructed
Having clarified the Heavens, one must now discuss the Earth
The Earth follows the Heavens, its Qi encompassing all
The Ten Directions’ Realms, and the Abyssal Depths
The Six Non-Existent, encircling the Central Peak
The Indistinct and Undivided, the Great Primordial Chaos
The Clouds drift—boundless, neither high nor low
The Vast and Silent, the limitless expanse
The Net of Heaven, the Three Realms’ splendor
The Mist of Fine Rain, the Great and Flourishing
The Great Compass’ Motion, unobstructed
The Four Cardinal Paths, the Eight Round Realms
Floating in the Void, sustained by the Wind
The Wind’s friction, the Qi’s ascent
The Diamond’s Strength, riding upon the Heavens
The Sun, Moon, and Stars, doubling their revolutions
Layered layers traversed, like rolling a pill
Yin and Yang—too much or too little
If rigidly opposed, calamities ensue
The Nine Yangs, the Sixteen Yin
The Celestial Locks, the Earthly Axes
Calculating the Rebirths, three thousand six
Yin’s negation, Yang’s fervor
Heaven’s exhaustion of Yin, Earth’s exhaustion of Yang
The Two Great Wheels, in shared contention
Gazing upon the Above and Below, humans dwell in the Middle
Distanced from the Four Quarters, entering the Vaulted Heavens
Counting this Earth, until the Great Cataclysm
Without the Dao’s Power, who would not perish?
The Nourished Earth, the Golden Grain Earth,
The Iron Earth, the Watery Earth,
The Great Wind Earth—these are the Five Earths
The Void, Form, and Moisture, reaching the utmost subtlety
The Fifth Soil, the Sixth Soil,
The Floating Soil—these are the Three Soils

**The Twentieth: The Paths of Immortals Across the Ages**
Guiding the People’s Scriptures, now clarified
Sixty-one stages, sequentially divided
The Way of the Supreme Sovereign, the Way of the Highest Truth,
The Way of the Mid-True, the Many Ways
Knowing their few, observing their openings
Unobstructed Void, entering the Multitude of Marvels
All who learn must embody this themselves
Aspirations steadfast, all virtues arise
Faith enables action, merit unmatched
Removing defilements, diligently refining
Studying diverse arts, distilling their essentials
Ascending the stages, thus deeply cultivating
Peering into the Lapis Circle, probing the Mysteries’ Depths
Attaining Void and Stillness, no trace remains
Once upon the King of Mu
Disgusted with mortal affairs
Lightly regarding wealth and honor, he wandered to Kunlun
Li the Eight-Hundred, the Ancient Lord of Shu
Departed in seclusion, his spirit dwelling with the tortoise
The Prince of Wang, enamored with Immortality
Following the Floating Isle, he returned on a crane

chunks.original_text: 善济物，马师皇。 愈龙疾，甘草汤。 介元则，有道术。 钓鲻鱼，献吴王。 董仲君，善服气。 曾被狱，隐形去。 幼学道，钱妙真。 居句曲，诵仙经。 七岁童，丁令威。 学仙道，千年归。 暨彗琰，修蝉蜕。 天目山，棺版飞。 冯薛氏，修苦行。 得尸解，玄鹤迎。 太玄女，少丧夫。 治仙术，坐行厨。 张珍奴，悔青楼。 感吕仙，得真修。 古高真，诰谛多。 嗟同人，易蹉跎。 作三字，勉初学。 细醋精，得至乐。 莫泥象，莫执文。 悟此理，乃为真。

The Benevolent Savior, Master Ma,
Healing the Dragon’s Ills with Licorice Decoction.
Jie Yuanze possessed Daoist arts,
Angling for Crucian Carp to present to King Wu.

Bo Dong, the Master of Breath Cultivation,
Once imprisoned, vanished by hidden form.
Young Moneyless Master studied the Way,
Dwelling at Jùqū, chanting Immortal Scriptures.

At seven, the boy Ding Lingwei
Studied Daoist arts and returned after a thousand years.
Ji Xiān and Xián Yán practiced the Cicada’s Shedding,
Their coffin borne aloft from Tianmù Mountain.

The Feng Xue clan endured harsh asceticism,
Achieving Corpse-Resurrection, greeted by the Dark Crane.

The Lady of Great Mysteries, young widowed,
Mastered Immortal Arts and sat in the Kitchen Hall.

Zhang Zhennu repented his brothel life,
Inspired by Lü the Immortal, attaining True Cultivation.

Ancient High Masters, their names—Guìdí Duō—
Alas, for those who linger, time slips away.
Three Characters written, urging the beginner’s path:
Refined vinegar essence brings supreme delight.

Do not cling to forms, nor fixate on texts—
Awaken to this truth, and thus attain the Real.
